para.text: Before offering services in connection with a fantasy competition to players physically located in Maryland, a fantasy competition operator shall register with the Commission.
A fantasy competition operator may not conduct an online fantasy competition unless registered to do so by the Commission.

A fantasy competition operator shall register with the Commission every year not more than 365 days from the date of its previous registration, if it is offering services in connection with a fantasy competition in Maryland.
A person required to register shall provide, in the manner specified by the Commission:
The name and principal address of the fantasy competition operator;
If a corporation, the state of incorporation and the full name and address of each officer, director, trustee, and principal salaried executive staff officer;
If a foreign corporation, evidence of qualification to conduct business in the State;
If a partnership or joint venture, the name and address of each owner and officer;
The name and address of the fantasy competition operator’s resident agent in the State;
The place where and the date when the fantasy competition operator was legally established and the form of its organization;
Information concerning each fantasy competition offered by the fantasy competition operator as described in Regulation .02 of this chapter;

Evidence satisfactory to the Commission that the fantasy competition operator has established and will implement procedures that prevent those individuals identified in COMAR 36.09.03.03 from participating in fantasy competitions;
A plan that describes how the fantasy competition operator will maintain compliance with COMAR 36.09.04;
A responsible gaming plan required under COMAR 36.09.05; and
Any additional information required by the Commission.
For each fantasy competition operator registered under this chapter, the Commission shall issue a registration certificate.
A fantasy competition operator registered under this chapter may operate fantasy competitions in accordance with this subtitle.
Information provided by the fantasy competition operator shall be available for public review.

In the event that information provided by the fantasy competition operator is no longer accurate due to a change in circumstances, a fantasy competition operator shall provide the Commission with the corrected information within 10 work days.
Prior to conducting a new type of fantasy competition, a fantasy competition operator shall submit proposed fantasy competition rules to the Commission.
A fantasy competition operator may offer minor variations of a fantasy competition without having to submit new fantasy competition rules to the Commission.
Minor variations of a fantasy competition include:
Offering a contest format for any sport, league, association, or organization previously offered for any fantasy competition;
Offering a fantasy competition only to employees of a fantasy competition operator;
The value of a fantasy competition and number of entries permitted;
Nonmaterial changes to entry fee and prize structure;
The number of athletes that a player selects to fill a roster when completing an entry;
The fields that a player must fill in when completing an entry;
Adjustments to a scoring system; and
Adjustments to a salary cap.
A registration fee of $100 shall be paid to the Commission to process a registration application of a fantasy competition operator.
The fees paid under this regulation are nonrefundable.
Unless a registration is renewed, a fantasy competition operator’s registration expires 1 year from the last date of registration.
The Commission may renew a fantasy competition operator’s registration if, before the term of the registration expires, the fantasy competition operator:
Applies for renewal no later than 45 days prior to the expiration of its current registration;
Submits updated and current copies of all of the documents and information required under Regulation .01 of this chapter; and
Pays a renewal registration fee in the amount of $100 to the Commission.
